reviews.review: Both my kids loved it! They said it was better then the first one. I in the other hand liked the first one better.
Beautifully done! Teared up at least twice!

Like the first movie, Frozen II also didn't have the main problem that makes by the main villain. It makes Frozen is so has a story that also fits an adult audience. The visual is so wonderful and make us bewitched. It can rise again magical animation era from Disney that present in the 90's. Frozen is the only best animation that has magical force from Disney in 2010's decade. But Frozen II didn't have a magical soundtrack- like the first movie because the arrangement of the song is not consistent. In one sequence so strict, and in other sequence so loose. I hope if it is a trilogy, it must be develope well because many people love all of this movie. From story, characters, until the song.
The best! Better than the first! Already seen it twice and hoping to see it one more time! Go watch! :)
Great Movie Great Message My 9 year old daughter really enjoyed also so 5 for me.
Disney does not disappoint.  We were all glued to the screen.  More character depth, fantastic songs/music, and they lived happily ever after!

The animation was great, and the story was OK, but in the end this movie really didn't serve any purpose other than fulfilling a second film for the franchise, although it was somewhat entertaining at times, more likely for kids than adults this time. Where the movie really fell flat was the music, which was a large part of the first film's greatness. The songs are not at all memorable and you will find yourself challenged to sing any of them as you leave the theater. I heard many movie-goers actually complaining about the music on the way out of the theater, so it was more than just me that thought this. Immediately following the film I asked my 9 year old niece what she thought and she said "the music kinda sucked." So there's that. Overall, worth the view if you are a Frozen 1 fan. Just don't expect too much and you will be fine. Just a notch up from a straight-to-video film I would say. It's doing well at the box office,  but is riding the coat-tails of Frozen 1, so will be interesting to see of a Frozen 3 makes it to the theaters.
I liked the 1st movie better. But this movie was good. Too much singing! The plot was great but I felt the characters sang the whole way through the movie. It felt like a musical.
Both my granddaughter (4 1/2 Years old) and I both loved it. Made us laugh and cry. The 3D was amazing. Never a dull moment.
Love the music. The special effects were amazing and the story was unexpected. Well worth watching and am looking forward to seeing again!
